inlet.digest: Buffer whose sample must be iterated

outlet.description: Sends a bang when the iteration has ended
The samples outlet outputs a list of samples (one for each buffer channel)

objarg.name: numbuffers
objarg.description: Sets the number of buffers to be iterated in parallel.

method.name: (mouse)
method.description: Double-clicking on the object will open the display window for the output buffer(s). If more than 10 buffers are to be output, only the first 10 are displayed.

method.name: list/llll
method.description:
A list or llll in the first inlet is supposed to contain buffer names and will trigger the buffer processing and output the processed buffer names (depending on the alloc attribute).
A number or an llll in the second inlet is expected to contain a iter parameter (depending on the ampunit) or an envelope (also see envampunit).

method.name: number
method.description: A number in the second inlet sets the iter parameter (depending on the ampunit).

method.name: reset
method.description: If the alloc attribute is set to 'Dynamic', the reset message will force the dynamic naming to cycle and restart from the first used buffer name. This is especially useful in combination with iterative mechanisms.

method.name: stop
method.description: When a stop message is sent to an object with blocking attribute set to 0, the computation is aborted as soon as possible.

method.name: write
method.description:
Message attributes:
@format (symbol, default: int16): Sample Format
See equivalent buffer~ method. Additional optional arguments specify the buffer index (if more than one buffer are stored in the objct) and the filename (otherwise a dialog menu will appear). Additional optional format message attributes specifies the output sample type, if applicable.
Accepted sampletype symbols are : 'int8' (8-bit integer), 'int16' (16-bit integer, default), 'int24' (24-bit integer), 'int32' (32-bit integer), 'float32' (32-bit floating-point), 'float64' (64-bit floating-point), 'mulaw' (8-bit mu-law encoding), 'alaw' (8-bit a-law encoding)
